jhave.question
Interface Question

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractQuestion, FIBQuestion, MCQuestion, MSQuestion, TFQuestion
public interface Question

Representation of a Question in the jhave system. This interface lays out the contract for all question implementations

Author:
Chris Gaffney

Field Summary
static byte TYPE_FILL_IN_THE_BLANK
          Fill in the blank type question.
static byte TYPE_MULTIPLE_CHOICE
          Multiple choice type question.
static byte TYPE_MULTIPLE_SELECTION
          Multiple selection type question.
static byte TYPE_TRUE_FALSE
          True / False type question.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String getAnswer()
          Returns the answer the user entered, null if the user has not entered an answer.
 java.lang.String getID()
          Returns the questions ID.
 java.lang.String[] getPossibleAnswers()
          Returns an array of possible answers.
 java.lang.String getQuestion()
          Returns the question the user is asked.
 byte getQuestionType()
          Returns the type of question as specified by the TYPE_* constants.
 boolean isCorrect()
          If the users answer is correct, always false if the user has not entered an answer.
 void reset()
          Reset the question to specify that no answer was entered.
 void setAnswer(java.lang.String answer)
          Set the users answer to the question.

Method Detail

getAnswer

java.lang.String getAnswer()
Returns the answer the user entered, null if the user has not entered an answer.

Returns:
String the answer entered by the user.

getID

java.lang.String getID()
Returns the questions ID.

Returns:
String question id.

getPossibleAnswers

java.lang.String[] getPossibleAnswers()
Returns an array of possible answers. For Fill in the blank questions this will return an array with a single empty string. For Multiple choice questions this will return the possible choices. For True / False questions this will return new String[] {"True", "False"}; For Multiple Selection Questions this will return the possible choices.

Returns:
String[] possible answers.

getQuestion

java.lang.String getQuestion()
Returns the question the user is asked.

Returns:
String question the user is asked.

getQuestionType

byte getQuestionType()
Returns the type of question as specified by the TYPE_* constants.

Returns:
byte question type.

isCorrect

boolean isCorrect()
If the users answer is correct, always false if the user has not entered an answer.

Returns:
boolean if the answer is correct.

reset

void reset()
Reset the question to specify that no answer was entered.

setAnswer

void setAnswer(java.lang.String answer)
Set the users answer to the question.

Parameters:
answer - users answer.
